title: Implement config validation (src/generator/validate.ts)
description:
## Task
Implement configuration validation to catch errors before generation begins.

## Validations
1. **Project name**
   - Must be valid npm package name
   - Kebab-case only
   - No leading dots or underscores

2. **Project path**
   - Must be valid filesystem path
   - If exists and not empty: error (unless --force)
   - Parent directory must exist

3. **Module selection**
   - At least one app module required (web, mobile, api, or storybook)
   - Storybook requires UI package (warn if ui=false)

4. **Dependencies between modules**
   - UI package is optional but recommended with web/storybook

## Implementation Notes
- Return array of validation errors
- Include helpful fix suggestions
- Check filesystem before validation

## File Location
src/generator/validate.ts

## Signature
```typescript
interface ValidationError {
  field: string;
  message: string;
  suggestion?: string;
}

async function validateConfig(config: ProjectConfig, flags: CLIFlags): Promise<ValidationError[]>;
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Invalid project names caught
- [ ] Existing non-empty dirs caught
- [ ] Empty module selection caught
- [ ] Returns helpful error messages

title: Create Husky pre-commit hook template (.husky/pre-commit)
description:
## Task
Create the Husky pre-commit hook template.

## File to Create
templates/husky/pre-commit.template

## Content
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env sh
. "$(dirname -- "$0")/_/husky.sh"

echo "Running pre-commit checks..."

# Run all checks - fail fast on first error
bun lint || exit 1
bun typecheck || exit 1
bun test || exit 1
bun build || exit 1

echo "All checks passed!"
```

## Placement
Generated at: .husky/pre-commit

## Important
- File must be executable (chmod +x)
- Must include shebang line
- Must source husky.sh for proper hook execution

## Alternative: Using Turbo
```bash
#!/usr/bin/env sh
. "$(dirname -- "$0")/_/husky.sh"

bun run ci
```

Where `ci` script in package.json is: `turbo lint typecheck test build`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Valid shell script
- [ ] All four checks run (lint, typecheck, test, build)
- [ ] Fails fast on first error
- [ ] File marked as executable in template metadata

title: Shared Packages - Config and UI package templates
description:
## Overview
Create the shared packages that provide consistent configuration and reusable UI components across the monorepo.

## Scope

### Config Package (packages/config) - REQUIRED
Always included in generated projects. Contains:
- tsconfig.base.json: Base TypeScript config (strict, ESNext, etc.)
- tsconfig.react.json: Extends base, adds JSX/React settings
- tsconfig.node.json: Extends base, adds Node.js settings
- eslint-config-custom.cjs: Shared ESLint rules
- prettier.config.cjs: Shared Prettier config
- package.json exporting all configs

### UI Package (packages/ui) - OPTIONAL
Only included if --ui flag is set. Contains:
- Minimal starter component (e.g., Button)
- TypeScript with React types
- package.json with react/react-dom as peerDependencies
- Proper exports configuration

## Key Design Decisions
- Use .cjs extension for ESLint/Prettier for CommonJS compatibility
- tsconfigs use "extends" pattern for DRY configuration
- UI package uses peerDependencies to avoid React version conflicts

## Dependencies
- Requires: Template System (turbokit-fay) - templates directory structure

## Success Criteria
- Apps can extend tsconfigs: "extends": "@{{scope}}/config/tsconfig.react.json"
- ESLint config importable: "extends": ["@{{scope}}/config/eslint-config-custom"]
- UI components importable: import { Button } from "@{{scope}}/ui"

title: Implement config merging logic (flags + prompts + defaults)
description:
## Task
Implement logic to merge configuration from multiple sources.

## Config Sources (priority order)
1. CLI flags (highest priority)
2. Interactive prompt responses
3. Default values (lowest priority)

## Implementation Location
src/config/merge.ts or within src/index.ts

## Merge Rules
- Explicit flags override everything
- Prompts fill in missing values
- Defaults used for remaining values
- --yes flag uses all defaults (skips prompts)

## Example Flow
```
flags: { name: 'my-app', web: true }
prompts: { path: './my-app', mobile: true }
defaults: { storybook: false, ui: false }
â†’ merged: { name: 'my-app', path: './my-app', web: true, mobile: true, storybook: false, ui: false }
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Flags always win
- [ ] Missing values filled from prompts
- [ ] --yes skips prompts entirely
- [ ] Final config is complete and valid

```yaml
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - name: Setup Bun
        uses: oven-sh/setup-bun@v1
        with:
          bun-version: latest
      
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: bun install
      
      - name: Lint
        run: bun lint
      
      - name: Type check

      - name: Test
        run: bun test
      
      - name: Build

```

### Mobile App (apps/mobile)

- React Native with TypeScript
- Extends @{{scope}}/config tsconfig.react.json
- Metro bundler configuration

### API App (apps/api)
- Bun runtime
- Hono framework for HTTP
- Extends @{{scope}}/config tsconfig.node.json
- Basic health check endpoint

### Storybook App (apps/storybook)
- Storybook 7+ with Vite builder
- React framework
- Configured to find stories in @{{scope}}/ui
- Extends @{{scope}}/config

## Key Files per App
- package.json (with workspace:* deps)
- tsconfig.json (extends config package)
- src/ directory with entry point
- App-specific config (vite.config.ts, app.json, etc.)

title: Template System - Template files, token replacement engine, and file copying logic
description:
## Overview
Build the template engine that copies, transforms, and writes template files to create the generated project.

## Scope
- Template directory structure mirroring the output monorepo
- Token replacement engine: {{projectName}}, {{scope}}, version placeholders
- Recursive directory copying with file filtering
- File writing with proper permissions
- Dry-run mode: print file tree without writing

## Key Files
- templates/root/ (package.json, tsconfig.json, turbo.json, .gitignore, .editorconfig)
- templates/apps/ (web/, mobile/, api/, storybook/)
- templates/packages/ (config/, ui/)
- templates/pipelines/ (ci.yml)
- src/generator/applyVariables.ts
- src/generator/copyTemplate.ts
- src/generator/writeFiles.ts
- src/generator/generate.ts (orchestrator)

## Token Variables
- {{projectName}} - kebab-case project name
- {{scope}} - npm scope (e.g., @myproject)
- {{year}} - current year for LICENSE
- Package versions should use workspace:* for internal deps

## Dependencies
- Requires: CLI Foundation (turbokit-3xw) for types and utilities

## Success Criteria
- Templates directory contains all required scaffolding files
- Token replacement handles all {{variable}} patterns
- Dry-run prints accurate file tree
- Generated files have correct permissions (especially scripts)

title: Implement main generator orchestrator (src/generator/generate.ts)
description:
## Task
Implement the main generator orchestrator that coordinates all generation steps.

## Generation Flow
```typescript
async function generate(
  config: ProjectConfig,
  flags: CLIFlags,
  logger: Logger
): Promise<void> {
  const steps = [
    'Creating project directory',
    'Copying root templates',
    'Setting up config package',
    'Setting up selected apps',
    'Setting up UI package', // if selected
    'Installing dependencies',
    'Setting up Husky',
    'Initializing git repository',
  ];
  
  // 1. Create project directory
  // 2. Copy root templates with variable replacement
  // 3. Copy packages/config templates
  // 4. For each selected app, copy its templates
  // 5. If ui selected, copy packages/ui templates
  // 6. Run bun install
  // 7. Setup Husky
  // 8. Git init + initial commit
}
```

## Implementation Notes
- Use logger.step() for progress indication
- Skip steps based on module selection
- Handle errors at each step gracefully
- Consider rollback on failure (delete partial project)

## File Location
src/generator/generate.ts

## Dependencies
- copyTemplate.ts
- applyVariables.ts
- writeFiles.ts
- installDeps.ts
- setupHusky.ts
- initGit.ts

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All steps execute in order
- [ ] Progress shown via logger
- [ ] Conditional steps based on config
- [ ] Errors handled gracefully
- [ ] Clean rollback on failure
